item.title: Tia add a quote by Charles M. Schulz
item.description: "Nothing takes the taste out of peanut butter quite like unrequited love." -- Charles M. Schulz

item.title: Tia add a quote by Robert Stackpole
item.description: "Heaven: it's better than a chocolate bar." -- Robert Stackpole

item.title: Tia add a quote by Arthur William Edgar O'Shaughnessy
item.description: "We are the music makers, and we are the dreamers of dreams." -- Arthur William Edgar O'Shaughnessy

item.title: Tia add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Tia add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: Tia add a quote by Peter Kreeft
item.description: "America does not know the difference between money and sex. It treats sex like money because it treats sex as a medium of exchange, and it treats money like sex because it expects its money to get pregnant and reproduce." -- Peter Kreeft

item.title: Tia add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Tia add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If we find ourselves with a desire that nothing in this world can satisfy, the most probable explanation is that we were made for another world." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Tia add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I'm on Aslan's side even if there isn't any Aslan to lead it. I'm going to live as like a Narnian as I can even if there isn't any Narnia." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Tia add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Tia add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "It's easier to bleed than sweat, Mr. Motes." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Tia add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "There is a crack in everything. That's how the light gets in." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Tia add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Oh, I get it," I said. "It's a parable. Cute. Let's go eat." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Tia add a quote by Jim Henson
item.description: "The most sophisticated people I know - inside they are all children. " -- Jim Henson

item.title: Tia add a quote by Joan of Arc
item.description: "I am not afraid... I was born to do this." -- Joan of Arc

item.title: Tia add a quote by St. Augustin
item.description: "la mesure de l'amour c'est d'aimer sans mesure" -- St. Augustin

item.title: Tia add a quote by St. Thomas Aquinas
item.description: "Beware the man of a single book." -- St. Thomas Aquinas

item.title: Tia add a quote by Mother Theresa
item.description: "I know God won't give me anything I can't handle. I just wish he didn't trust me so much." -- Mother Theresa

item.title: Tia add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "Beauty was deceptive. I would rather wear my pain, my ugliness. I was torn and stitched. I was a strip mine, and they would just have to look. I hoped I made them sick. I hoped they saw me in their dreams." -- Janet Fitch

item.title: Tia add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "Remember it all, every insult, every tear. Tattoo it on the inside of your mind. In life, knowledge of poisons is essential. I've told you, nobody becomes an artist unless they have to." -- Janet Fitch

item.title: Tia add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "Let me tell you a few things about regret...There is no end to it. You cannot find the beginning of the chain that brought us from there to here. Should you regret the whole chain, and the air in between, or each link separately as if you could uncouple them? Do you regret the beginning which ended so badly, or just the ending itself?" -- Janet Fitch

item.title: Tia add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "Oleander time, she said. Lovers who kill each other now will blame it on the wind. " -- Janet Fitch

item.title: Tia add a quote by Janet Fitch
Tia add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "How right that the body changed over time, becoming a gallery of scars, a canvas of experience, a testament to life and one's capacity to endure it." -- Janet Fitch

item.title: Tia add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "To know I was beautiful in his eyes made me beautiful. " -- Janet Fitch

item.title: Tia add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "The pearls weren't really white, they were a warm oyster beige, with little knots in between so if they broke, you only lost one. I wished my life could be like that, knotted up so that even if something broke, the whole thing wouldn't come apart." -- Janet Fitch

item.title: Tia add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "Her hatred glittered irresistibly. I could see it, the jewel, it was sapphire, it was the cold lakes of Norway." -- Janet Fitch

item.title: Tia add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "Aquamarines grew with emeralds, Claire told me. But emeralds were fragile and always broke into smaller pieces, while aquamarines were stronger, grew in huge crystals without any trouble, so they weren't worth as much. It was the emerald that didn't break that was the really valuable thing." -- Janet Fitch

item.title: Tia add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "How can I shed tears for a man I should never have allowed to touch me in any way?" -- Janet Fitch

item.title: Tia add a quote by Janet Fitch
item.description: "I understood why she did it. At that moment I knew why people tagged graffiti on the walls of neat little houses and scratched the paint on new cars and beat up well-tended children. It was only natural to want to destroy something you could never have." -- Janet Fitch
